content: an all-over cabled toque for keeping out winter s chill body finished sizes child adult s adult l to fit a heads begin working with larger circular needles and work one approximately 19 21 23 in circumference round of k6 p1 ribbing yarn dawn orchid bfl worsted 100% british bfl cable pattern round 1 *3/3rc p1 3/3lc p1 repeat from wool 182 yds per 100g 1 skein shown in * to end of round midwinter cable pattern rounds 2-6 k5 p1 around needles 4 5mm us7 16 circular & dpns/magic loop and 4 0mm us6 16 circular repeat cable pattern rounds 1-6 six times in total then rounds 1 & 2 an additional time gauge 28 sts = 4 in cable pattern other tools stitch marker cable needle darning needle crown brim switch to dpns or magic loop when needed using smaller circular needles cast on 96 108 120 sts decreasing 1 *k4 k2tog p1 ssk k4 p1 repeat from * to using a stretchy cast on of your choice place marker end of round 96 108 120 sts and join in the round decreasing 2 *k5 p1 repeat from * to end of round work k1 p1 ribbing for 1 5 2 2 decreasing 3 *ssk k3 p1 k3 k2tog p1 repeat from * to increasing *k2 kfb k2 p1 repeat from * to end of round end of round 80 90 100 sts 112 126 140 sts k knit decreasing 6 *k3 ssk repeat from * to end of round 64 p purl 72 80 sts k2tog knit 2 together ssk slip 2 sts knitwise move decreasing 7 *k1 k2tog k1 repeat from * to end of both to left needle and k 2 round 48 54 60 sts together through back of loop decreasing 8 *k2tog k1 repeat from * to end of round 3/3rc put 3 sts on cable needle 32 36 40 sts and hold in back k3 sts from left needle k 3 sts from cable decreasing 9 k2tog around 16 18 20 sts needle decreasing 10 k2tog around 8 9 10 sts 3/3lc put 3 sts on cable needle and hold in front k 3 sts from break yarn and draw through remaining stitches weave left needle k 3 sts from cable in all ends needle 2/2 rc put 2 sts on cable needle and hold in back k2 sts from left needle k 2 sts from cable needle 2/2lc put 2 sts on cable needle and
